full.title: A Patient With Focal Myositis and Primary Cutaneous Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma: A Case Report.
full.authorString: Wu Q, Xu C, Wang L.

authorAffiliation.affiliation: Cadre Ward Two, General Hospital of Central Theater Command of the People's Liberation Army, Wuhan, China.
Department of Oncology, General Hospital of Central Theater Command of the People's Liberation Army, Wuhan, China.
Cadre Ward Two, General Hospital of Central Theater Command of the People's Liberation Army, Wuhan, China.

full.abstractText: We report a rare case of a 92-year-old male, with a history of statin/ezetimibe intake, complained of pain and swelling of left forearm. The patient was diagnosed with focal myositis at first. Symptoms aggravated after 2 months of immunomodulatory therapy, and accompanied with protrusion lesion at left elbow. Biopsy of the protrusion lesion turned out to be primary cutaneous diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
full.affiliation: Cadre Ward Two, General Hospital of Central Theater Command of the People's Liberation Army, Wuhan, China.

title: A Patient With Focal Myositis and Primary Cutaneous Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma: A Case Report.
